repnme.cdata!:
Congo, Democratic Republic of - Emergency
            Living Conditions Improvement Support Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Emergency Living
            Conditions Improvement Support Project for the Congo,
            Democratic Republic of were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            high, the Bank performance was moderately satisfactory, and
            the Borrower performance was also moderately satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned included: design of an emergency
            project needs to balance many competing and sometimes
            opposed objectives in an unpredictable environment with
            shortage of information, and hence flexibility underpins
            success. Capacity constraints should be addressed up-front
            and from many angles. Sustainability should be built in from
            the design phase, but addressed on an ongoing basis.
            Restructuring should be pro-actively used to mitigate design
            shortcomings that are likely to surface during
            implementation given appraisal difficulties, and to adapt to
            changing circumstances.

repnme.cdata!:
Congo, Democratic Republic of - Emergency
            Living Conditions Improvement Support Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Emergency Living Conditions Improvement Support Project for
            the Congo, Democratic Republic of (DRC) is to assist the
            Government in improving living conditions by strengthening
            the socio economic situation in key urban centers and in two
            isolated areas i.e.: (i) improving delivery of basic
            services in provincial capitals and key medium urban
            centers; and (ii) restoring key transport links to reconnect
            two isolated regions. The project was restructured in 2010
            and extended for one (1) year to modify the scope and design
            and allow the completion of the activities. The main reason
            for the restructuring is to respond to the changing client
            needs, whereby certain activities are no longer a priority
            for the Government of DRC, which requested the Bank to focus
            on a set of key activities under PUSPRES (Projet
            d'urgence du Soutien au Processus de Reunification
            Economique et Sociale - Emergency Economic and Social
            Reunification Project)) that face a financing gap. A
            recommendation was made during the April 2010 supervision
            mission to prepare an additional financing to fill the
            financing gap. The additional financing option could not be
            pursued because of lack of International Development
            Association (IDA) funding. Subsequently, other options were
            explored, and the option of using the ongoing PUAACV (Projet
            d'urgence d'appui a l'amelioration des
            conditions de vie - Emergency Living Conditions Improvement
            Support Project) to finance the remaining activities was retained.

Congo, Democratic Republic of -

repnme.cdata!:
Congo, Democratic Republic of - Emergency
            Living Conditions Improvement Support Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Emergency Living Conditions Improvement Support Project for
            Congo is to assist the Government in improving living
            conditions by strengthening the socio economic situation in
            key urban centers and in two isolated areas - i.e.: (i)
            improving delivery of basic services in provincial capitals
            and key medium urban centers; and (ii) restoring key
            transport links to reconnect two isolated regions. The main
            reason for the restructuring is to modify the scope and
            design of the project by closing component C, with a current
            disbursement rate of 92 percent, and component D, which
            remains undisbursed as most of the activities were financed
            by the Government and the provinces and the remaining will
            be financed by the donors.  The unused funds will be
            reallocated for use under components A and B to ensure that
            the Project Development Objective (PDO) can be achieved by
            the new completion date of September 30, 2011. The changes
            will not have a major effect on the original economic and
            social aspects of the project.
